newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia T-bill profits tax amendment takes effect.
newsitem.headline: Russia T-bill profits tax amendment takes effect.

text.p: Russia formally extended a profits tax to Treasury bill earnings on Tuesday with the official publication of an amendment to profits tax law.
Top parliamentary and government officials said on Monday that the law would tax Russian T-bill earnings at levels of 35-43 percent, instead of 15 percent, which the market expected.

Alexander Pochinok, deputy chairman of the Duma's budget committee, said the omission of the word "discount" from the law meant GKO treasury bills and OFZ government bonds would be taxed at normal rates under the profits tax legislation.
Profits tax, which did not previously apply to government securities, is 43 percent for banks and 35 percent for non-banks.
Only OFZ coupons would be taxed at the 15 percent rate, which lawmakers originally envisioned for all government securities profits, Pochinok said.
The law, passed by the lower and upper houses of parliament on December 25 and 26, is part of a package designed to raise funds for the 1997 budget.
